page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: INTERVIEW WITH RESIDENT:SEMI-RETIRED HORSE-SALESMAN. I now own only this house and garden. Now semi-retired, I work part-time for the horse-feed business, which will probably expand its production of pony-nuts and constantly improving feed for thoroughbreds.This is a lonely area but my wife and I are closely involved in the community,supporting the church and running the gymkhana.The new "link" road will bring more people into the area, expanding the village of Littleham and pushing out the "green belt".The E.E.C affects farmers around here,who resent the grain and milk quotas. Most of my spare time is spent in the garden,for recreation I go mostly to Torrington or Barnstaple. My wife and I are Yorkshire people but it's much prettier here and we feel part of a closely-knit community.
